result.execSummary:
The defendant Damen N. VANATTA was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Execution of sentence is stayed and the defendant is placed on probation to DOC.

miscConds.notes:
To Destinee Pritzl at 2311 Monroe Street, Two Rivers, WI.
To be paid within the first 12 months of probation.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment or work search as directed.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with Destinee Pritzl, Tanner Cook or Frank Meyer (a/k/a JR Burt).

Provide DNA sample.

Defendant is to use one doctor to prescribe medication and use only one pharmacy unless more are approved by the agent.

Defendant is to write a letter of apology to the victim.  That letter is to be approved by the agent and the agent will foward it to the victim.

timeConds.notes:
Under the Huber Law, commencing immediately.  The Court will allow NA meetings at the jail.

Additional two (2) months in the county jail, under the Huber Law, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damen N. VANATTA

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.   
State files an Amended Information amending the charge to robbery with threat of force, contrary to Section 943.32(1)(b) of the Wisconsin Statutes, a Class E felony.   No contest plea to the amended charge.   Convicted.   Sentencing hearing is set for 02-03-16 at 1:30 p.m.   Defendant is ordered to submit DNA.   
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.   
Minutes.
Plea date at 01-28-2016 11:30 am
Plea date at 01-28-2016 01:30 pm
Jury trial at 02-02-2016 08:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 01-26-2016 01:30 pm
Order Denying Motion to Modify Bail.
Scheduling conference at 11-19-2015 11:15 am
Amending the location of the crime to "City of Two Rivers".
Cover letter.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 11/19/2015, at 10:45 a.m.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 10-29-2015 at 1:20 p.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
BAIL MODIFICATION HEARING -
Counsel argue.   Court denies the motion.  State to draft Order.   
Minutes.
Motion to Modify Bond.
Cover letter.
Eric Pangburn, through public defender.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 10-14-15 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
Cover Letter.
RE:  Destinee Pritzl, on 09-27-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of armed robbery as repeater.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 10-05-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,500.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with Tanner Cook and Destinee Pritzl or any premises they occupy.  Defendant is to have no contact with Frank Meyer a/k/a JR Burt.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
